title: Question 3
prompt:
Sentence 2: Leaving a job can have long-termpositive or negative affects on your career.

Which is the best way to write the underlined portion of this sentence? If the original is the best way, choose option (A).
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
The words affect and effect are commonly confused. The most common meaning of the word affect is a verb meaning to influence. The most common meaning of the word effect is a noun meaning a situation caused by something. When you affect something, it has an effect.

affect (verb) to influence
effect (noun) a situation caused by something
When you affect something, it has an effect.

To decide which word to use, decide whether the word is a noun or a verb. Could you say “affected” if the sentence were in the past tense? It sounds wrong, so the word is not a verb. Another clue is that the word is plural. It is a noun, so the correct word is “effects.”

Leaving a job can have long-term positive or negative effects on your career.
